title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 §§ 81-2.6 - Notice requirement for companies engaged directly in business pursuant to section 1714(a)(i) of the insurance law
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 §§ 81-2.6 - Notice requirement for companies engaged directly in business pursuant to section 1714(a)(i) of the insurance law

State Regulations

Every domestic life insurer shall provide a notice on form NA (see Appendix 22, infra) to the superintendent within 30 days of first engaging directly in any of the businesses authorized by section
1714 (a)(i)
of the Insurance Law, provided that no such notice shall be required with respect to any such business in which the domestic life insurance company had been engaged in during the year immediately preceding the effective date of this Subpart. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11
§§
81-2.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
